comment: Took his online Precalculus. As with some online classes, there was no partial credit and grading was automated. The prerecorded lectures were decent, but nothing to write home about. Test questions were often VERY different from the HW problems. I would be very wary to take him for any math classes more rigorous than precalculus.

Calc is already hard enough and taking an online calc class is even harder. Lectures are pre-recorded and he WRITES MATH IN CURSIVE so it's very hard to understand. Tests are proctored with proctor-U with no partial credit and no credit for work shown. He does not curve and gives no extra credit. Everything is computer graded. DO NOT TAKE HIM.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: terrible! do NOT take! he didn't want to give a curve until students emailed him. the tests are hard & they barely match the homework or the practice exams. he was also very snappy about giving back points on exams (which are proctored). he barely offered any additional help besides his 1 office hour on MWF. also, he didn't offer any extra credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Don't take him online. All lectures are pre-recorded with pre-written notes that are hard to watch through and the assignments/tests are all computer-graded. Each exam is typically 20 questions (mostly mc) and there is no credit for work shown. From my experience he does not curve or offer extra cred. However, he is very nice and easily accessible.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I dont know what happened between last semester and this year. but it the complete opposite. Loads of homework and review test consisting of 20+ questions and barely any are on the actual tests. Does not curve on tests. There were problems on the test that werent even reviewed in the lectures/homework .avoid
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: He's a really nice guy and is pretty easy to talk to outside of class if you have a specific question. The textbook is useless and his lectures are long and confusing, I just watched other profs on youtube. Pretty heavy homework load and tests are very difficult. Be prepared to make this class your #1 focus for the semester and you'll get through.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is a really sweet guy. I liked watching his lectures, they were helpful. His extra practice homework helped too. Only four tests. This was hard because it was an online class, I think he would be better in person. This class uses ALEKS which is difficult. No extra credit. He did drop our lowest homework grade which was nice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Math is hard for me - so any teacher is going to be difficult for me. Not much interaction with the teacher the class was online.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Fadyn is a very nice professor. His lectures are long but he really knows how to teach the subject in a way that is understandable. This was a summer class so it was very fast paced, make sure you don't fall behind. 4 tests, decent amount of hw, and an optional final. If you're looking for a good calc professor, take him!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took him for Cal1 and Cal2. Solid professor, good pacing. 4 tests, homework (worth a test) and the OPTIONAL final replaces your lowest one of those five grades. He gave extra credit both semesters and was really fair. If he was teaching Cal 3 in the fall, I would have taken him a 3rd time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You are graded by 5 parts each worth 20% of the grade. Test 1,2,3,4 and homework. Final is optional and replaces lowest grade out of the 5. Everything was explained into detail on his online lectures! super easy class! notes were allowed on tests! i barely studied and barely watched the lectures. Everything was Super similar to the homework on MML.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: took him for calc 2. His class is pretty easy if you work and study hard. Don't depend on the extra credit and/or curve to get you through. His tests are okay as long as you understand the material. His last two exams were so very difficult, but this was when the coronavirus caused the university to go online so that might be why
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: straight forward guy so dont expect any favors .lecture heavy but he tries to break if down but its math its hard ask questions .he gives extra credit in class and he tries to tie he to lecture but test are way harder than class and homework so don't bank on the extra credit
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Fadyn was a great teacher. While the class was hard, so is Calculus II in general. He always went over the homework in the beginning of class, and did lots of questions on the material to help. He offers extra credit and a curve at semester's end. If you are going into calculus II, TAKE FADYN!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Professor Fadyn was a great teacher for Calculus 1. The class is composed of 4 tests, a homework grade, and an optional final. He gives very good test reviews that are almost identical to the format of the test, with just slightly different numbers. The homework is a lot, but you have a good amount of time to do it, so just don't put it off.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Do not miss any of his classes or else you will be so lost. There are 4 tests,homework,and the optional final, so be careful with grades. The final will replace your lowest score, but if you make a lower score on the final,its still replaces that lowest grade, so be careful, do your best to avoid taking the final by getting high grades.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Bear in mind I took this over the summer and I also got an A in Calc I. This class was the hardest thing to ever wrap my mind around. The tests are multiple choice but don't let that fool you. The test average for the first two tests was 58 and 64. I had to drop to save my gpa. His tests will be 10X harder than any of the hw or practice in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: His test are more difficult than other Calc 1 professors but offers plenty of bonus problems and curves the final grade if needed to where the class average is a high C. He does go fast but will stop and spend more time on something if someone has a question. He also goes over homework at the beginning of class. makes math understandable.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: With Fadyn the tests he gives are tough but fair. The class in general is not an easy one and after not receiving a grade good enough to fill the prerequisite I needed I finally got a good grade of an 83 with him. There are 4 tests and the final replaces the worst one for better or worse which is fair considering the tests are multiple choice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: The test averages for the first two tests were low. Tests are HARD. He teaches at a good pace but it gets way to complicated sometimes. At the end of the semester you can take an optional final to replace your lowest test grade but if you take it and make a lower score it will still replace it which doesn't help students at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: 4 tests, 100 points each. Each hw (webassign) grade is 25, so all four count up to be 100. He goes at a great pace, 30 minutes for hw questions, 30 minutes for lecture each class. He doesn't just go by the book either. Sometimes, he will skip around in a way that he sees fit, and it's quite helpful. He introduces topics in a simplified way. Take!!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Honestly one of the best math teachers I have ever had. Is very good at explaining the math problems, and process of solving the problems. Is easier compared to some other teachers I have heard about on campus. Allows calculators w/o CAS on tests. tests are all mc. no partial credit. 10-15 questions. Do as much practice as you can to get A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Four tests. Four homework assignments (web-assign, 80 questions each). The final replaces your lowest test grade, REGARDLESS of what you got. However, you can opt out of the final with an A average. All of the hw assignments combined equal a single test grade. No calculators on tests (tf you expect?) thirty minutes for hw questions, then lectur
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I am a math major, and I think it's a difficult subject. His tests are multiple choice and he gives you a practice test so you literally know what to expect. His lectures give a clear understanding of what is happening. Be ready to surrender your life to webassign though. Overall, I wouldn't have received an A if I took another professor.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Fadyn is the man, took him for both Calc 1 and 2 and hes prob the best teacher ive ever had. Tests are similar to the practice exams, and he is a great lecturer, explains everything very well. Didn't take the final, since its optional, but have heard it was pretty simple. Do the homework, that's the only part that sucks. its 20% of your grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I took Calculus in high school, so I already had grasped much of the topic, but Fadyn made his class very easy. Math is hard for many, but this professor is patient, and willing to work with you to understand math. His study guides are helpful for the tests, and the final is optional! There's only 4 hw assignments, but you get a month to do each.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: I've had Dr. Fadyn for Calc 1 and Calc 2, honestly the best math teacher I've ever had. I've gotten A's in both even though the material is hard. He's patient and doesn't make anything too hard. The tests are multiple choice and he gives practice tests that are nearly identical. He has a great sense of humor and is always willing to help you pass.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: This is the best math professor at KSU. I took calc over the summer and he made it real understandable. I cannot recommend him enough. Do the homework and go to class, and you will be fine. Tests are straight forward and he wants to make sure you understand the material. I will be taking him for all my higher math classes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Easy A. His study guides were VERY similar to his tests. The only difference between his tests and study guides is that he changes the numbers, so if you get the basic idea of how to do a problem then you should be set for his tests. I took his class during the summer and passed every test with an A.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: a great choice for calc 2 instructor. I'm not sure how I feel about multiple choice exams as I probably missed quite a bit of partial credit but I also got lucky a couple of times in picking the right answer when the time was running out. Optional final is cumulative and could replace your lowest test grade but if lower can bring your grade down.

Calc 2 is hard no matter who you take, but Fadyn did a solid job teaching. There were 4 tests and 4 Webassign homeworks (he mentioned that this was a first for him) that add up to 1 test grade. Optional final replaces lowest grade. No lecture material is posted online, so definitely show up to class. I did feel that an A was remotely attainable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: He really is a good professor and a nice guy. This was his first semester doing mandatory homework so there was a good bit of it but it was nice to have that extra  grade in. My only complaint about him is that his exams are all multiple choice (personally I prefer free response for partial credit).

Professor Fadyn although sometimes a little goofy a good choice as a Calc I professor. He knows his stuff and explains the material in a very understandable way. He will help anyone who asks, and spends part of his lectures going over any requested homework problems. He also provides a study guide that's tremendously helpful for test prep.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Calc 2 is a tough class but Fadyn makes it more manageable. Web assign homework, and 4 reasonable multiple choice tests, no partial credit. He allows calculators. He's explains things very straight forward. In my opinion he's one of the best math professors at this school. But unless you're a calc god you still have to put in work to do well.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Skip class? You won't pass.--Respected

comment: Fadyn is definitely unique. His teaching methods are straightforward but the homework and tests he gives are distinctly harder (his tests are multiple choice). But he will go over whatever you ask for. Final replaces lowest test, even if lowest test score is higher.  He uses WebAssign, but if you do the work your grade goes up.

This has to be one of the best math professors I've ever had. He teaches it in a way that you can understand and he always asks if anyone has questions. His study guides are amazing, they really help with the test. Study and pay attention and you should do fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Was a easy class as it was a review from a previous calc class in high school. He had 4 tests, optional homework, and an optional final that replaced your lowest test.  He doesn't take attendance so I spipped about 1/3 of the classes and did fine. When it came to new information he was also a really good teacher. I'm taking him again for calc 2.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor. He is the most genuine and caring person I have met so far at KSU. You have four tests plus an optional final that replaces your lowest grade. Lectures provide plenty of knowledge for the tests, it is just up to you if you want to put in the time to pass. Don't expect to skip and pass unless you know the material. Take him!
rating_tags: Respected--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: Goes off the PowerPoint and gives a practice test before each test. There were 4 tests that made up 90% of your grade. If you do the practice test you will at least get a B on the test. I would take him again very easy. Optional Exam replaced  your lowest test grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Hilarious

comment: I just finished taking Calc II with Fadyn over an 8 week summer course. Besides the fact that classes were 4 hours long, the class was not that bad. The home work was not mandatory, but doing it helped. He spent 30 minutes to a hour going over HW. There were four tests plus an optional final. A study guide for each test as well. Highly recommend

He is a great teacher, and explains the concepts in a way that people can understand it. He makes study guides that resemble the test. The tests are multiple choice. There are four tests and an optional final. The final replaces your lowest grade whether you do better or worse. There is some extra credit.

Dr. Fadyn is the best math teacher I have ever had. He makes practice tests that we go over the day before the test. He is clear and gives great help. No question is a dumb question. He is very willing to help and work with you on your grades.

I have taken Dr. Fadyn for both Calc 1 and 2. Math is not my best subject but I passed 1 with a B and amazingly 2 with an A. He gives 4 tests and then the final is optional depending on how you are doing in the class. He always gives a practice test the week prior and give you an exact guide as to what to study for.  Sometimes offers extra credit:)

He gives a ton of homework but it is not mandatory.  He will go over it at the beginning of every class. He only gives out 4 tests that are multiple choice and an optional final that replaces your lowest test regardless of what you get on it.  So you can get lower than your lowest test grade and lower your grade in the class.  Final is 50 problems.

Fadyn is a great math teacher. He teaches the concepts well and answers questions in detail. Make sure you do the homework even though he doesn't collect it. The study guides is like the test questions in that order, but he doesn't give the same questions on the test. There are 4 tests and an optional final. The final replaces the lowest test grade

Calc 2 isn't an easy subject, but Fadyn makes it tolerable. Homework isn't mandatory but I recommend doing it. Multiple choice test so it's hit or miss. Gives a study guide before each test which are almost identical with different numbers. Really nice guy. He is down to earth and will make a miserable math class somewhat bearable.

Currently taking him for Calc 1. He goes over the homework problems very well. The homework itself is not bad. His tests are multiple choice which is good. There really isnt enough tests though. got a 76 on the first, a 57 on the second, and just took the third. His tests come from his study guides, tests are nothing like the study guides though..

AVOID HIM! took him for Discrete and his tests were ridiculous. His grading is outrageous, I asked about why he graded it the way he did and refused to tell me but instead said its his way and his decision. Its an easy subject but he expects you to have a PHD in it. If you take him make sure to do all hw problems. DONT TAKE HIM!

Had him for dif eq  and thought he really knew his math but not so great a teacher. extra help was there if you needed it but who's got any extra time these days?  if you got plenty of time to invest to learn what he didn't explain clearly  in class the first time around take this prof, otherwise avoid.

Great ODE teacher. I've heard some people complain about his linear algebra course being extremely difficult, but that is not the case for ODE. And somebody in another review complained about his cursive handwriting. I'm in my 30's, don't wear glasses, and sat on the back row everyday. Never once had a problem reading his writing.

Had Fayden for both Discrete and Linear and both were challenging courses and will require you to do most if not all the homework assigned and tests are reasonable to a certain extent except when he put proofs on Linear tests, but all in all he is one of the good but not great math teachers at SPSU.

Extremely difficult for a Linear Algebra class. Most the class was hovering between a C/D for most the class. Lets you use a 3x5 for each test, four tests worth 25% each - final is optional and can replace your lowest grade. Final consists of 20 multiple choice questions, can use four 3x5 notecards. Lots of proofs, hard to read his cursive.

Great math teacher most subjects but he is horrible with Linear Algebra.  This class is supposed to be an "easy A" but it is far from it.  Spent the entire semester floating on the C/D fence and didn't know until the last class what I would be making.  I suggest avoiding him for Linear Algebra but he is great with other classes. Final is optional.

I understand that he is a great diff EQ prof, but he is a terrible Linear Prof, he loves proofs and concepts on his tests. He rambles a lot, and teaches stuff that "wont be used in this class" that being said, I will take him for diff EQ soon.

Multiple choice questions on differential equations exam will tear you apart. Allows a you to bring a notecard for exams. Sometimes focuses on something for a long time that is not on the exam, but briefly teach something that is on the exam. He's different.

TAKE THIS PROF!  Such a great professor!  Willing to slow down and answer questions very clearly!  Has the patience of a saint and always respects his students.  If you can get Fadyn for any maths class, take him...you won't be disappointed.

AVOID!!! I took him for Calculus 3. Fadyn breezed through the course, and would not slow down to explain basic concepts despite my constant requests that he do so. I had to teach myself. Course speed was too fast, and he didn't care because he had a schedule to keep. He does not collect homework or give quizzes. Your tests count for everything.

His practice tests help you study for the real tests but don't be fooled, you will need to do the homework and example problems in each section. He allows a 3x5 card (both sides) since there is no way you can remember every variation to each type of problem.

An alright professor. He goes into far too much detail sometimes, which get boring. Still a pretty fair teacher. He knows what grades to expect on every test before taken, and he knows his math. Could be taught in a more interesting fashion.

Best math teacher I've had. Had him for Dif Eq. and Linear Algebra. He's a very good teacher and really knows the material. He is easy to understand and helpful. Do the homework and don't slack off and you can get an A. He let's you have a 3x5 card of notes for the test which is really helpful. I'd recommend him for any class you can get him for.

Great professor and if you put forth the effort it isn't hard to achieve an A. It's a high  level math class, don't be lazy and expect to do well. Doing the homework helps a lot, like all math classes. Gives a study guide before tests that help a lot. If I had to take anymore maths I'd be sure to take him.

Dr. Fadyn is an excellent calculus teacher. I took caluculs II from him this past Summer. The ten week course was fast paced and hard. He helped make the material understandable. He curves his test which are multiple choice but don't confuse that with being easy. I intend on taking him again for differential equations.

Great professor, and very easy to make an A if you apply yourself. You have 4 tests grades and that's it, no quizzes, and if you are happy with your grade after the tests, then you just don't take the final. You get note cards for tests. He very clearly explains everything and is really helpful. If you don't make an A, it's because you didn't try.
Took for Diff eq. he goes step by step on everything. you really don't have to learn anything on your own which is so nice. you should study, but class is easy to follow.

Dr. Faydn is a real teacher! His presentation of the material is very easy to understand, he hands out practice tests to study (with answers) that are similar to the real tests, and allows you to skip the final if you're happy with your grade. I have two more math classes and will make sure he is my instructor for both.

Definitely a great teacher with great spirits! His class was very enjoyable and his test very fair. In our class, if were happy with your average you skipped the final (big help). Take any class with him, you'll enjoy it.

Great teacher, very funny, very helpful. Not much to say, he is always willing to give help out of class. Best part is if you get an average of an A on your tests you can admit the final. Make sure to take this professor.

He is a great Differential Equations  professor, grades are only taken for tests, no HW or quizzes.  final exam is optional, can be taken to drop one of 4 tests through the semester.  Watch out for the first test, most people did the worst on that test.  He is funny and easy to follow, very good at explaining, I would defiantly recommend him.

Dr. Fadyn is the best math teacher I've ever had. He explains everything out in great detail and is easy to understand. He also gives out a review test before the test that is very similar to the actual test. Exam is optional and replaces your lowest test grade.

Dr Fadyn is the best math teacher I ever had. I took him at Brenau, and if it wasnt for him and his teaching style- I dont think I would of ever been able to graduate from college- Thank you Dr Fadyn for being an OUTSTANDING teacher who cares about their students. SD

He is great, take him and enjoy the class. There are 4 exam each 25% of final and if you are happy with your garde you can skip the final. it is easy to make an A. he is agreat teacher in every aspect. Just take him, and nobady else.

A recommended teacher. Teaches his material very well. Gets mixed up at times on problems, and sometimes confusing, but more often on target. He hands out a fictious test (multipal choice)similar to his real test to study for. Homework counts for something like 10%. Class was fun too
Multiple Choice tests, but good teacher. Final is optional but it may hurt you.
Multiple choice tests are awful! Not very clear when he does homework problems. Very interesting character but poor teacher.

Fadyn is one of the hardest math professors I've ever had. He presents the material pretty well, but his tests are multiple choice problems crafted like the hardest problems on the homework assignments. Most students dropped his class, myself included, simply because the nature of the tests had us guessing between A and C. Multiple choice math -.-.
Do the homework and go to class. About half way through my semester with him, the class dropped by at least 2/3
He is easy....Test are out there...uses same ones over and over

Great professor, teaches the material very well.. Yet be aware of multiple choice... Be very alert doing exams... But him being a great teacher out weighs the 100% multiple choice on his tests! Take him if you can!
Very clear and helpful. Excellent teachings skills. Willing to work with students outside of class. Fair tests.
The multiple choice text can really mess you up.  But he does curve the grades.  So there is always a good chance of passing
No Comments
Good teaching, do the homework and go to class, at least a B
likes to help students, very easy tests, just do the homework and get an A
No Comments
great professor!!! HEADS UP!: he LOVES maple. he's very willing to help students, lots of extra credit, but you'll have to work for it.
